title: iMessage reactions finally rolling out to more users in Google Messages
content:
iMessage reactions have long annoyed Android users, but soon that issue will be a thing of the past. In November last year, Google Messages started testing a new feature that converts a reaction sent by an iMessage user to an appropriate emoji for the Android recipient — instead of regurgitating reaction in words like Laughed at

The post iMessage reactions finally rolling out to more users in Google Messages appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Google Messages has picked up a new beta update that finally adds support for iMessage reactions. Read on to know more.
